title: US, China Resume In-Person Military Policy Coordination Talks
description: US and Chinese defense officials held policy coordination talks at the Pentagon on Monday and Tuesday — the first such in-person meetings since before the coronavirus pandemic.

title: To Protect Election From China, Taiwan Disenfranchises Thousands of Voters
description: Shielding Taiwan’s elections from potential interference by China is such a concern for the self-governing democracy that it’s been willing for years to disenfranchise hundreds of thousands of eligible voters to do so.

title: Xi Elevates China’s Ties With Record Number of Nations to Counter US
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping upgraded diplomatic ties with a record number of countries last year as he seeks to rally the Global South to help reshape the US-led world order.

title: Trump Pauses Campaigning to Face Skeptical Appeals Court Judges
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, legal correspondent Emily Birnbaum looks at Donald Trump’s day in court. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: UK’s Cameron ‘Worried’ Israel May Have Broken International Law
description: Britain’s foreign secretary, David Cameron, said he’s “worried” that Israel might have broken international law during the conflict in the Gaza Strip, and that the country must to do more to allow aid to flow.

title: Xi’s Empty Dream City Shows Limits of His Power, Even in China
description: China has spent more than double the cost of the Three Gorges Dam on building a futuristic megacity. But will people come?

title: Senate Republicans Float Renewing Short-Term Funding Ahead of Shutdown Deadline
description: Congress will need another temporary spending measure to avert a Jan. 20 partial government shutdown, Senate Republican leaders said Tuesday in comments that risk provoking backlash from House conservatives.

title: Beijing Has No Room to Compromise on Taiwan, China’s Top Envoy Says
description: China has no room to compromise with those advocating “Taiwan independence,” Beijing’s top envoy in Washington said ahead of Saturday’s presidential election in the island.

title: US Lawmaker Urges Probe of UAE Firm G42’s Ties to China
description: A key US lawmaker is urging the Commerce Department to consider trade restrictions on Abu Dhabi artificial intelligence firm Group 42 Holdings over its ties to China.

title: Austin Was Hospitalized Over Complications From Prostate Surgery
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin was hospitalized for complications suffered after he underwent surgery to treat prostate cancer, doctors at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center said in a statement.

title: White House Demands Official Notifications After Austin's Hospitalization
description: The Biden administration ordered Cabinet members to notify the White House if they’re forced to delegate authorities, after Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin waited four days to tell senior officials he’d been hospitalized last week.

title: Hochul Rejects New York Tax Hikes, Touts NYC Housing Breaks
description: Governor Kathy Hochul called for a new tax break to promote affordable housing and increase support for fighting crime in New York City Tuesday.

title: Almost 500,000 Darfur Refugees Face Humanitarian Crisis in Chad
description: Almost 500,000 people fled from West Darfur in Sudan to eastern Chad to escape violence in 2023 and now face a dire humanitarian crisis with limited food, water and health care, Doctors Without Borders/Medecins Sans Frontieres said.

title: Cameron Says China More Aggressive Than During His Era of Ties
description: UK Foreign Secretary David Cameron said China had become “more aggressive and assertive” in recent years, arguing “a lot has changed” since he had pursued a warm relationship with Beijing as prime minister.

title: Blinken Urges Israel to Think of Postwar Role
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken made another push for Israel to limit civilian casualties in Gaza and sought to focus on the country’s relationships with Arab nations, part of renewed US efforts to end the conflict.

title: Thiam Quits Kering Board to Focus on Ivory Coast Politics
description: Former Credit Suisse chief Tidjane Thiam resigned from the board of France’s Kering SA in order to focus on politics in the Ivory Coast, the company said in an e-mailed statement.

title: Macron’s Ambitious New Premier Attal Faces a Tough Road Ahead
description: In some ways, Gabriel Attal, the 34-year-old picked by Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday as France’s youngest and first out gay head of government, has been a political star-in-the-making for well over a decade. In a television interview of students at the prestigious university Sciences Po in 2012, Attal made an impassioned speech for why the country’s youth is as engaged in politics as ever, prompting his schoolmates to crown him a “future president.”

title: Asda Owner TDR Backs Issa Brothers in UK Parliament Grilling
description: A top private equity executive has defended the bosses of Asda from accusations that they are unfairly pushing up food and gas prices.

title: Norway’s Parliament Approves Deep Sea Mining in Arctic
description: Norway’s parliament approved commercial mineral exploration in the country’s Arctic waters even as the environmental and fishing lobbies pushed back against the move.

title: Amazon Attacks EU Privacy Watchdog It Claims Was Out to Get It
description: Amazon.com Inc. hit back at regulators who slapped it with a then-record European Union privacy fine of €746 million ($814 million), claiming their aim was punishment rather than protecting people’s data.

title: Russia Reduces December Crude Output by Most Since Cuts Started
description: Russia curbed its crude oil output in December by the most since starting its cuts in early 2023, yet the nation still pumped more than its target, according to Bloomberg calculations based on official data.

title: Fugitive Lawmakers Throw Poland Into More Political Disarray
description: The speaker of Poland’s parliament warned the country could be spiraling toward a constitutional crisis as two former ruling party officials wanted by the police were given refuge by the president.

title: Ecuador Suffers Surge of Violence After Noboa Declares Emergency
description: Ecuador saw renewed violence overnight after President Daniel Noboa imposed a nationwide curfew as part of a state of emergency declared amid a manhunt for a notorious drug lord.

title: Trump Lawyers Argue Election Case Opens Past Presidents Up to Criminal Charges
description: Prosecuting Donald Trump for trying to overturn the 2020 election raises questions about whether other past presidents could have been criminally charged over official acts, his lawyer told a federal appeals court panel.

title: Putin to Nationalize Defense Plant After Thousands Lost Heat
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered a defense plant producing ammunition to be nationalized after it triggered a heating failure in an area near Moscow amid freezing temperatures, the local governor said.

title: White House Assembles Climate Advisers on LNG Export Approvals
description: The Biden administration is said to be reevaluating the climate criteria it uses when approving new liquefied natural gas export facilities in a move that has the potential to stall pending projects as the 2024 election nears.

title: Big Batteries May Save UK Power System Up to £24 Billion by 2050
description: Long-duration energy storage could save the UK power system billions of pounds as the country seeks reliable backup supply amid a push to expand offshore wind, according to consultants LCP Delta.

title: Blinken, Macron and Li to Headline World Economic Forum in Davos
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, French President Emmanuel Macron and Chinese Premier Li Qiang are among global luminaries set to attend the World Economic Forum in Davos.

title: Global Firms Face Radical Tax Changes If Minimum Levy Bites
Former Post Office Boss at Center of UK Scandal Returns Honor
description: The former chief executive of Britain’s Post Office said she is returning an honor awarded to her in the name of the monarch, following a major backlash against the organization after hundreds of workers were wrongly convicted of theft.

title: Told You So: BlackRock Warns Bond Vigilantes Watching Election Pledges
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Singapore Prosecutors Review Transport Minister Case: Paper
description: Singapore’s Corrupt Practices Investigation Bureau completed a probe involving Transport Minister S. Iswaran, the Business Times reported, citing Minister Chan Chun Sing’s written reply to a question in parliament on Tuesday.

title: Thailand Moves to Ban Recreational Use of Cannabis in Setback for Nascent Industry
description: Thailand is proposing a ban on recreational use of cannabis and hefty penalties on offenders under a new bill that seeks to end a legal vacuum after the country became the first in Asia to decriminalize the plant.

title: Even at $112,000 Starting Pay, Fewer People Want to Be Cops
description: The path to one of the most lucrative entry-level jobs in US law enforcement begins at a squat police academy nestled on a residential street in San Francisco. Enrollment has been plunging.

title: Macron Names Ally Gabriel Attal French Prime Minister at 34
description: Emmanuel Macron appointed a 34-year-old ally as France’s prime minister in a bid to bring fresh impetus to his administration just months ahead of European Parliament elections, according to the president’s party.

title: US and Allies Met Secretly With Ukraine on Peace Plan
description: A secret meeting took place last month between Ukraine, its Group of Seven allies and a small group of Global South countries to try to rally support for Kyiv’s conditions for holding peace talks with Russia, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Populism’s Rise Prompts European Leaders to Scramble
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Why Indians are Threatening to Boycott the Maldives
description: A social-media post by Prime Minister Narendra Modi promoting an Indian tourism destination has escalated into a diplomatic spat with the Maldives, India’s sand-swept island-chain neighbor. The Maldivian government has suspended three ministers over the dispute, an Indian travel website has halted bookings to the Maldives and Indian celebrities have taken to social media to slam the tourism-dependent island nation known for its picture-perfect beaches and luxury hotels. The dispute underscores t

title: Trump Faces DOJ in Court Seeking Immunity for Jan 6. Charges
description: Donald Trump’s lawyers will spar with federal prosecutors Tuesday in a high-stakes court battle to determine if he is immune from charges of trying to overturn the 2020 election because he was president at the time.

title: Russia’s Crude Exports Start 2024 in Line With Pledged OPEC+ Cut
description: Shipments were 300,000 barrels a day below May-June average in the first week of 2024

title: Scholz Faces Mounting Pressure as Allies Side With Angry Farmers
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz is coming under increasing pressure to offer additional concessions to German farmers after four regional leaders from his own Social Democratic party urged him to rethink plans to cut agriculture subsidies.

title: Jokowi to Discuss South China Sea With Marcos in Philippines
description: Indonesia President Joko Widodo said the situation in the South China Sea as well as trade will be among his discussion points with Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. during his visit to Manila.

title: Russia Arrests US Citizen Accused of Drug Trafficking
description: A Moscow court placed a US citizen under arrest for attempted drug trafficking, the latest of several Americans to be detained in Russia in recent years.

title: Macron Seeks a Reset After Pushing Out Prime Minister Borne
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is seeking to inject new energy into his administration after a bruising political year, pushing out Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne and getting set to name a close ally as successor.

title: Taiwan Activates Air Raid Alert After Chinese Satellite Fly-Over
description: Taiwan sent out an air raid alert after China apparently launched a satellite over the southern part of the island, an event that caused some anxiety days before a pivotal presidential election.

title: South Korea’s Parliament Passes Bill to End Dog Meat Consumption
description: South Korea’s parliament passed a bill to do away with the consumption of dog meat through a rare unanimous vote on the legislation that President Yoon Suk Yeol has pledged to enact as law.

title: Washington Says Bangladesh Elections Were Neither Free Nor Fair
description: The US said the Bangladesh elections were not free or fair amid reports of vote irregularities and violence, potentially testing ties between the South Asian country and its top trading partner.

title: BlackRock Warns of UK Bond Selloff Risk as Election Year Begins
description: BlackRock Inc. strategists are watching out for the election promises of UK political parties as any plans for much greater spending could spark a revolt in the bond market.

title: South Korean Parliament Endorses Bill to Outlaw Eating Dog Meat
description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea’s parliament has endorsed landmark legislation outlawing dog meat consumption.

title: Thai Premier to Meet With Central Bank Governor After Calling for Lower Interest Rates
description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin said he will meet with Bank of Thailand Governor Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput on Wednesday to discuss a range of issues, a day after prodding the central bank to consider lowering interest rate.

title: ‘We Can Die’: Sailors Describe the Long, Tense Red Sea Passage
description: Even at top speed, the journey through one of the world’s main shipping lanes is lengthy and terrifying.

title: Taiwan Hopeful Lai Vows to Raise the Democracy’s Profile Abroad
description: The presidential candidate for Taiwan’s ruling party indicated he’d work to further raise the island’s profile on the world stage if elected, adding to signs he’d stick with policies that have irked China.

title: Trump Prosecutor Had Improper Romance, Co-Defendant Claims
description: Fani Willis, the Atlanta-area district attorney, improperly hired a romantic partner to help prosecute election fraud charges against Donald Trump and 18 others, a co-defendant of the former president alleged in a court filing.

title: Trump Hopes Any US Market Crash Happens Under Biden And Not Him
description: Donald Trump said he hopes any US economic crash happens this year and not during his prospective second term.

title: Nikki Haley Sees Possibility of a Federal Ban on Late-Term Abortions
description: A broad agreement could be reached to outlaw late-term abortions in the US, Nikki Haley told Iowa voters as she seeks to project herself as an alternative to her chief opponents, Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis, just a week before the state’s caucuses.

title: Pentagon Under Pressure Over Defense Secretary Austin’s Absence
description: US lawmakers demanded answers from the Pentagon after Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin failed to notify the White House about his hospitalization for four days, saying they weren’t satisfied with the explanation for his absence.

title: Xi, Biden and the $10 Trillion Cost of War Over Taiwan
description: Taiwan's election highlights the potential for a conflict that would decimate the global economy.
